title: Geocode Dutch addresses
text: default, nl_geocode search addresses. addresses lot information available: can also search multiple addresses . can see, address doesn’t need exact match. Uppercases ignored.
code: library(nlgeocoder)  res <- nl_geocode("Martinikerkhof 3 Groningen") print(res["weergavenaam"])   Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field   Geometry type: POINT   Dimension:     XY   Bounding box:  xmin: 6.568567 ymin: 53.21927 xmax: 6.568567 ymax: 53.21927   Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84                           weergavenaam              centroide_ll   1 Martinikerkhof 3, 9712JG Groningen POINT (6.568567 53.21927) colnames(res)    [1] "bron"                   "woonplaatscode"         "type"                      [4] "woonplaatsnaam"         "wijkcode"               "huis_nlt"                  [7] "openbareruimtetype"     "buurtnaam"              "gemeentecode"             [10] "rdf_seealso"            "weergavenaam"           "straatnaam_verkort"       [13] "id"                     "gekoppeld_perceel"      "gemeentenaam"             [16] "buurtcode"              "wijknaam"               "identificatie"            [19] "openbareruimte_id"      "waterschapsnaam"        "provinciecode"            [22] "postcode"               "provincienaam"          "nummeraanduiding_id"      [25] "waterschapscode"        "adresseerbaarobject_id" "huisnummer"               [28] "provincieafkorting"     "centroide_rd"           "straatnaam"               [31] "score"                  "centroide_ll" locations <- c("Martinikerkhof 3", "st jansstr 4 groningen", "9726AE 4", "9711 ME 1") res <- nl_geocode(locations) data.frame(query = locations, result = res$weergavenaam)                      query                              result   1       Martinikerkhof 3  Martinikerkhof 3, 9712JG Groningen   2 st jansstr 4 groningen Sint Jansstraat 4, 9712JN Groningen   3               9726AE 4   Stationsplein 4, 9726AE Groningen   4              9711 ME 1    Museumeiland 1, 9711ME Groningen

what: Search for different type of locations
title: Geocode Dutch addresses
text: Besides addresses, can also search places, municipalities, provinces, roads many . See LocatieServer API documentation complete list types can choose . can restrict output nl_geocode municipalities : can also restrict output places: interested results particular area (instance province municipality) can use fq parameter.
code: res <- nl_geocode("Groningen", type = "gemeente")  res[c("weergavenaam","type")]    Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 2 fields   Geometry type: POINT   Dimension:     XY   Bounding box:  xmin: 6.620635 ymin: 53.21859 xmax: 6.620635 ymax: 53.21859   Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84           weergavenaam     type              centroide_ll   1 Gemeente Groningen gemeente POINT (6.620635 53.21859) res <- nl_geocode("Groningen", type = "woonplaats")  res$weergavenaam   [1] "Groningen, Groningen, Groningen" res$type   [1] "woonplaats" res <- nl_geocode("Hoofdstraat", fq = "provincienaam:Groningen")  res$weergavenaam   [1] "Hoofdstraat, Beerta" res$provincienaam   [1] "Groningen"

what: Return coordinates in a spatial dataframe with CRS WGS84 or RD_New
title: Geocode Dutch addresses
text: default, nl_geocode return sf object coordinates coordinate reference system WGS84 (EPSG:4326). also possible specify coordinates RD_New (EPSG:28992), Dutch coordinate reference system. can also use nl_geocode_rd function instead:
code: res <- nl_geocode("Martinikerkhof 3 Groningen")  st_crs(res)["epsg"]   $<NA>   NULL res <- nl_geocode("Martinikerkhof 3 Groningen", output = "rd")  st_crs(res)["epsg"]   $<NA>   NULL res <- nl_geocode_rd("Martinikerkhof 3 Groningen")  st_crs(res)["epsg"]   $<NA>   NULL

title: Geocode Dutch addresses
text: can use parameter output indicate want labels, geometry.
code: res <- nl_geocode("Martinikerkhof 3 Groningen", output = "data.frame")  class(res)   [1] "data.frame"

what: Plot the output on a map
title: Geocode Dutch addresses
text: Plotting output map, default nl_geocode returns sf object.
code:
data("addresses") library(leaflet) poi_geocoded <- nl_geocode(addresses$Address) leaflet(width = "100%", height=600) %>% addPdokTiles("gray") %>% addCircleMarkers( data = poi_geocoded , popup = paste("",addresses$POI, "
", poi_geocoded$weergavenaam) )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Willy Tadema. Author. Egge-Jan Pollé. Author. Edwin de Jonge. Author, maintainer. Juris Breidaks. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tadema W, Pollé E, de Jonge E (2025). nlgeocoder: Geocoding Netherlands. R package version 0.2.1, https://github.com/uRosConf/nlgeocoder.
code: @Manual{,   title = {nlgeocoder: Geocoding for the Netherlands},   author = {Willy Tadema and Egge-Jan Pollé and Edwin {de Jonge}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.1},   url = {https://github.com/uRosConf/nlgeocoder}, }

title: Geocoding for the Netherlands
text: can install nlgeocoder CRAN Development version (use risk!) can installed github :
code: install.packages("nlgeocoder") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("uRos2018/nlgeocoder")

title: Geocoding for the Netherlands
code: library(nlgeocoder) address <- nl_geocode( c("Henri Faasdreef 312", "Leidschenveen")) address[c("weergavenaam")] # this is a sf object #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 4.399247 ymin: 52.06491 xmax: 4.40042 ymax: 52.06593 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>                                      weergavenaam              centroide_ll #> 1       Henri Faasdreef 312, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage  POINT (4.40042 52.06593) #> 2 Laan van Leidschenveen 27, 2493CT 's-Gravenhage POINT (4.399247 52.06491) colnames(address) #>  [1] "bron"                   "woonplaatscode"         "type"                   #>  [4] "woonplaatsnaam"         "wijkcode"               "huis_nlt"               #>  [7] "openbareruimtetype"     "buurtnaam"              "gemeentecode"           #> [10] "rdf_seealso"            "weergavenaam"           "straatnaam_verkort"     #> [13] "id"                     "gekoppeld_perceel"      "gemeentenaam"           #> [16] "buurtcode"              "wijknaam"               "identificatie"          #> [19] "openbareruimte_id"      "waterschapsnaam"        "provinciecode"          #> [22] "postcode"               "provincienaam"          "nummeraanduiding_id"    #> [25] "waterschapscode"        "adresseerbaarobject_id" "huisnummer"             #> [28] "provincieafkorting"     "centroide_rd"           "straatnaam"             #> [31] "score"                  "gekoppeld_appartement"  "centroide_ll"

title: Geocoding for the Netherlands
code: ## basic example code adres <- nl_suggest("Dam, Amsterdam") head(adres$response$docs, 2) #>   type            weergavenaam                                   id    score #> 1  weg          Dam, Amsterdam weg-ab6df5babb15e466f3699b5d2c22e110 9.380681 #> 2  weg Damloperspad, Amsterdam weg-c57e61425c421a206015596b41c92259 6.352306 #>   adrestype #> 1      <NA> #> 2      <NA>

title: Geocoding for the Netherlands
code: obj <- nl_lookup("weg-ab6df5babb15e466f3699b5d2c22e110") names(obj) #>  [1] "bron"               "woonplaatscode"     "type"               #>  [4] "woonplaatsnaam"     "nwb_id"             "openbareruimtetype" #>  [7] "gemeentecode"       "rdf_seealso"        "weergavenaam"       #> [10] "straatnaam_verkort" "id"                 "gemeentenaam"       #> [13] "identificatie"      "openbareruimte_id"  "provinciecode"      #> [16] "provincienaam"      "centroide_ll"       "provincieafkorting" #> [19] "centroide_rd"       "straatnaam"

what: Leaflet function to add pdok tiles — addPdokTiles
title: Leaflet function to add pdok tiles — addPdokTiles
text: function adds PDOK tile layers leaflet::leaflet(). small wrapper around leaflet::addTiles() sets correct urls layers.

title: Leaflet function to add pdok tiles — addPdokTiles
code: addPdokTiles(   map,   type = c("brt", "aerial", "pastel", "gray"),   group = match.arg(type),   options,   ... )

title: Leaflet function to add pdok tiles — addPdokTiles
text: map leaflet object type one PDOK tiles: currently: "brt", "aerial", "pastel" "gray" group group set equal type options passed leaflet::addTiles() ... Passed leaflet::addTiles().

title: Leaflet function to add pdok tiles — addPdokTiles
text: PDOK provides tiles can used tile layer several geovisualization tools including leaflet. layers differ tile layers Openstreetmap, Google cartomap following manner: tiles restricted Netherlands: tiles accross Dutch border "grayed ". useful cartographic applications restricted Dutch geo-information. tiles open source based open sourced geo-information.

what: Several Points of Interest (POI) that are included for test purposes. — addresses
title: Several Points of Interest (POI) that are included for test purposes. — addresses
text: POI, points interest Address, Uncleaned address information.

title: Several Points of Interest (POI) that are included for test purposes. — addresses
code: addresses

title: Several Points of Interest (POI) that are included for test purposes. — addresses
text: object class data.frame 5 rows 2 columns.

title: Free geocoding search — nl_free
text: function wraps "free" pdok service, allows free search. syntax examples see documentation pdok. easy/convenient simpler function geocoding nl_geocode().

title: Free geocoding search — nl_free
code: nl_free(   q,   rows = NULL,   start = NULL,   fq = NULL,   lat = NULL,   lon = NULL,   type = NULL,   fl = NULL,   df = NULL,   ...,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Free geocoding search — nl_free
text: q query geocoding service. rows maximum number rows returned. Default 10. start start index.Default 0. fq apply filter query, e.g. fq=bron:BAG. default filter 'type:(municipality town neiborhood road postcode adress)'. Use fq=* remove default filter. lat enter decimal degree (latitude, WGS84). Together lon define point search . Search results ordered distance point. example: 'lat=52.09&lon=5.12' lon enter decimal degree (longitude, WGS84). Together lat define  point search . Search results ordered distance point. example: 'lat=52.09&lon=5.12' type restrict results specific type. fl fields return. df field search . ... parameters passed pdok webservice verbose logical function print messages.

title: Free geocoding search — nl_free
text: result pdok free webservice converted R list object.

title: Free geocoding search — nl_free
code: if (requireNamespace("sf", quietly = TRUE)){   l <- nl_free("Henri Faasdreef 312")   l$response$numFound   l$response$docs["weergavenaam"] } #>                                  weergavenaam #> 1   Henri Faasdreef 312, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 2              Henri Faasdreef, 's-Gravenhage #> 3       Henri Faasdreef, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 4         Henri Faasdreef 194T, 's-Gravenhage #> 5  Henri Faasdreef 200A, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 6  Henri Faasdreef 222A, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 7    Henri Faasdreef 46, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 8    Henri Faasdreef 48, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 9    Henri Faasdreef 50, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 10   Henri Faasdreef 52, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
text: nl_geocode returns vector addresses probable object/location. function user friendly barebones webservices (nl_free()), uses function signature ggmap::geocode.

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
code: nl_geocode(   location,   output = c("wgs84", "rd", "data.frame"),   messaging = FALSE,   type = "adres",   ...,   verbose = messaging )  nl_geocode_rd(   location,   messaging = FALSE,   type = "adres",   ...,   verbose = messaging )  nl_geocode_df(   location,   messaging = FALSE,   type = "adres",   ...,   verbose = messaging )

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
text: location string location found output output data.frame() sf::sf() object wgs84 Rijksdriehoekstelsel format? messaging Print urls fired webserver (consistent ggmap::geocode) type restrict type object returned service, see details possible types. ... passed nl_free(). verbose identical messaging (consistent nlgeoder functions)

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
text: return type can specified can type "sf" "data.frame", depending value output.

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
text: type can one following: "provincie", "gemeente" , "woonplaats", "weg", "postcode", "adres", "perceel", "hectometerpaal", "wijk", "buurt", "waterschapsgrens", "appartementsrecht".

title: Geocode adresses — nl_geocode
code: data("addresses") r <- nl_geocode(addresses$Address, output = "data.frame") r["weergavenaam"] #>                          weergavenaam #> 1  Martinikerkhof 3, 9712JG Groningen #> 2 Sint Jansstraat 4, 9712JN Groningen #> 3    Museumeiland 1, 9711ME Groningen #> 4   Stationsplein 4, 9726AE Groningen #> 5      Hereplein 73, 9711GD Groningen names(r) #>  [1] "bron"                   "woonplaatscode"         "type"                   #>  [4] "woonplaatsnaam"         "wijkcode"               "huis_nlt"               #>  [7] "openbareruimtetype"     "buurtnaam"              "gemeentecode"           #> [10] "rdf_seealso"            "weergavenaam"           "straatnaam_verkort"     #> [13] "id"                     "gekoppeld_perceel"      "gemeentenaam"           #> [16] "buurtcode"              "wijknaam"               "identificatie"          #> [19] "openbareruimte_id"      "waterschapsnaam"        "provinciecode"          #> [22] "postcode"               "provincienaam"          "centroide_ll"           #> [25] "nummeraanduiding_id"    "waterschapscode"        "adresseerbaarobject_id" #> [28] "huisnummer"             "provincieafkorting"     "centroide_rd"           #> [31] "straatnaam"             "score"                   # or if you have sf installed if (requireNamespace("sf", quietly = TRUE)){   r_sf <- nl_geocode(addresses$Address, output = "wgs84")   print(r_sf) } #> Simple feature collection with 5 features and 31 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 6.563506 ymin: 53.21085 xmax: 6.57079 ymax: 53.21978 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   bron woonplaatscode  type woonplaatsnaam wijkcode huis_nlt openbareruimtetype #> 1  BAG           1070 adres      Groningen WK001400        3 adres      Groningen WK001400        4                Weg #> 5  BAG           1070 adres      Groningen WK001400       73                Weg #>          buurtnaam gemeentecode #> 1 Binnenstad-Noord what: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
title: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
text: Retrieve detailed properties geo object found nl_suggest() nl_free().

title: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
code: nl_lookup(id, ..., output = c("list", "raw"), verbose = FALSE)

title: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
text: id object found nl_suggest nl_free ... extra parameters passed lookup service pdok. output type output returned verbose function print message retrieving data?

title: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
text: Depending value output raw search results R format properties specific object R list object.

title: Look up a geo object — nl_lookup
code: obj <- nl_lookup("weg-f633e85f07eda4e68a00fb13f9d128f5", output = "list") names(obj) #>  [1] "bron"               "woonplaatscode"     "type"               #>  [4] "woonplaatsnaam"     "nwb_id"             "openbareruimtetype" #>  [7] "gemeentecode"       "rdf_seealso"        "weergavenaam"       #> [10] "straatnaam_verkort" "id"                 "gemeentenaam"       #> [13] "identificatie"      "openbareruimte_id"  "provinciecode"      #> [16] "provincienaam"      "centroide_ll"       "provincieafkorting" #> [19] "centroide_rd"       "straatnaam"         obj$weergavenaam #> [1] "Henri Faasdreef, 's-Gravenhage"

text: experimental reverse api

title: experimental reverse api — nl_reverse

what: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
text: nl_suggest returns list suggestions location description.

title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
code: nl_suggest(   q,   ...,   rows = NULL,   type = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   fl = NULL,   sort = NULL,   qf = NULL,   bq = NULL )

title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
text: q search terms geolocated ... parameters passed geolocation service rows maximum number rows returned. Default 10. type restrict type geolocation type (see details possible types) verbose functions print messages retrieving. fl columns returned (aka select columms result) sort data sorted qf fields queried bq boosting query.

title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
text: result pdok suggest webservice converted R list object.

title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
text: type can one following: "provincie", "gemeente" , "woonplaats", "weg", "postcode", "adres", "perceel", "hectometerpaal", "wijk", "buurt", "waterschapsgrens", "appartementsrecht".

title: Get a list of suggestions for geolocations in NL — nl_suggest
code: sug <- nl_suggest("Henri Faasdreef")  # how many objects have a score? sug$response$numFound #> [1] 83  # get suggestions sug$response$docs #>     type                               weergavenaam #> 1    weg             Henri Faasdreef, 's-Gravenhage #> 2  adres        Henri Faasdreef 194T, 's-Gravenhage #> 3  adres Henri Faasdreef 200A, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 4  adres Henri Faasdreef 222A, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 5  adres   Henri Faasdreef 46, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 6  adres   Henri Faasdreef 48, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 7  adres   Henri Faasdreef 50, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 8  adres   Henri Faasdreef 52, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 9  adres   Henri Faasdreef 54, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #> 10 adres   Henri Faasdreef 56, 2492JP 's-Gravenhage #>                                      id     score  adrestype #> 1  weg-f633e85f07eda4e68a00fb13f9d128f5 13.016960       <NA> #> 2  adr-1d3163476d43616d78b557e3677772b4  9.380771 hoofdadres #> 3  adr-a54cd6b2f28d51ed4a846b18a277574e  8.227918 hoofdadres #> 4  adr-f91cc969743132a5bef901e9652aa665  8.227918 hoofdadres #> 5  adr-f153b063bda514bdfbd1f1aa30195dda  8.164826 hoofdadres #> 6  adr-a918509f36018befde09ecf3289b585b  8.164826 hoofdadres #> 7  adr-29ce30ea148498820add258ab527809a  8.164826 hoofdadres #> 8  adr-b6abc14b0cfe9d98d375da89ac73fca7  8.164826 hoofdadres #> 9  adr-b528df1688412211f0e1bb903fc3f4f0  8.164826 hoofdadres #> 10 adr-5d62d284842ccb673a92aef8d9971e04  8.164826 hoofdadres

title: nlgeocoder package — nlgeocoder-package
text: nlgeocoder package provides R wrapper around pdok webservice.

title: nlgeocoder package — nlgeocoder-package
text: allows geocode data using following functions: nl_geocode(): geocode vector addresses. nl_free(): find possible matches one address. nl_suggest(): find possible suggestions one address. nl_lookup(): lookup information object found nl_suggest.

title: nlgeocoder package — nlgeocoder-package
text: Maintainer: Edwin de Jonge edwindjonge@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Willy Tadema Egge-Jan Pollé contributors: Juris Breidaks [contributor]

what: Dummy function only used for describing common api parameters — query
title: Dummy function only used for describing common api parameters — query
text: Dummy function used describing common api parameters

title: Dummy function only used for describing common api parameters — query
code: query(   rows = NULL,   start = NULL,   fq = NULL,   lat = NULL,   lon = NULL,   indent = NULL,   wt = "json" )

title: Dummy function only used for describing common api parameters — query
text: rows maximum number rows returned. Default 10. start start index.Default 0. fq apply filter query, e.g. fq=bron:BAG. default filter 'type:(municipality town neiborhood road postcode adress)'. Use fq=* remove default filter. lat enter decimal degree (latitude, WGS84). Together lon define point search . Search results ordered distance point. example: 'lat=52.09&lon=5.12' lon enter decimal degree (longitude, WGS84). Together lat define  point search . Search results ordered distance point. example: 'lat=52.09&lon=5.12' indent return JSON pretty print (true) (false). Default true. wt output format. Possible values json xml. Default json.

title: nlgeocoder 0.2
text: Fixed url PDOK geocoder (issue #7).

title: nlgeocoder 0.1.4
